1. How would you describe the lighting in your viewing environment?
  
   a) No room light, display only
   b) Daylight from the window
   c) Warm-LED
   d) Office fluorescent
   e) Sunlight
   f) Mix of Sunlight and Fluorescent
   g) Mix of office fluorescent and sunlight
   h) Mix: daylight + cool white + warm white
   i) Office + Daylight Mix
   j) Other (please specify)

Please propose ways to improve this questionnaire posed after an experiment on image quality in the experiment, participants have rated images of different content (nature, animals, people) with different distortions (blur, jpeg and contrast). Also propose potential other questions that can be added. I already know participants age, race and gender.


Mandatory fields are marked with a star*

After-experiment Survey
Please enter your experiment/prolific ID
Which browser did you use? (e.g. Chrome, Edge, Firefox, Safari or Opera)
Please provide the brand and model number of the monitor you are currently using. (e.g. Samsung LC27F398FWNXZA)
What is the resolution of your current monitor? (e.g. 720p (1280x720))
What is the size of your monitor? (e.g. 22”)
When did you purchase your current monitor? (e.g. 2018)
What is the main purpose for which you use your current monitor?

Work or productivity


Gaming


Entertainment (movies, TV shows, streaming)


Graphic design or video editing


General browsing and social media


Other (please specify)
If you selected other above
Please select the option that best describes the lighting in your viewing environment

No additional light, display illumination only


Warm-led (yellowish tone)


Cool led (bright white tone)


Fluorescent (office lighting)


Sunlight


Mix of multiple light sources (please specify in the text box below)
If you selected "Mix of multiple light sources" above
What is the highest level of formal education you have completed? 
 If you are currently in full-time  education please put your highest qualification to date 


GCE A levels or below, or equivalent


HNC, HND, NVQ at level 4+, Foundation Degree or equivalent


Bachelor's Degree or equivalent


Master's Degree or equivalent


Doctorate or equivalent
How often do you access the Internet for any purpose (i.e. for work/leisure etc.)?
This should include access from any device (desktop, laptop, tablet or mobile) and from any location (home, work, internet café or any other location) 


More than 10 times a day (select this if you feel like you are always connected to the internet)


Between 6 and 10 times a day


Between 2 and 5 times a day


Once a day


4-6 days a week


2-3 days a week


Once a week


Less often than once a week
How frequently do you take photographs?

Multiple times a day


Daily


Several times a week


Once a week


Several times a month


Once a month


Rarely or never
How often do you edit or retouch your own/others' images?

Never


Rarely


Occasionally


Frequently


Very frequently
Which of the following subjects do you most often photograph? (Select all that apply.)
You have to select at least one option.

Landscapes/nature


Animals


People


Food


Events (e.g. weddings, concerts, festivals)


Travel destinations


Still life (e.g. objects, flowers)


Other [please specify in the next box]
If you answered other above
Was the 5 point scale (Bad, Poor, Average, Good, Excellent) adequate to describe the quality of the images you saw?
Would you prefer any changes to the scale? (E.g more/fewer points or different names)
In your own words, how would you describe the difference in quality between an "excellent" and "poor" image?
Was there something unclear in the instructions before the experiment began?
Is there anything in this experiment that could be better from your perspective?
Is there anything else you want to add?

After-experiment Survey
Please fill out the following information after completing the image quality experiment. Your feedback is valuable to us. Mandatory fields are marked with a star(*).

1. *Please enter your experiment/prolific ID:

2. *Which browser did you use for the experiment? (e.g. Chrome, Edge, Firefox, Safari, or Opera):

3. *Please provide the brand and model number of the monitor you are currently using (e.g. Samsung LC27F398FWNXZA):

4. *What is the resolution of your current monitor? (e.g. 720p (1280x720)):

5. *What is the size of your monitor in inches? (e.g. 22”):

6. *When did you purchase your current monitor? (e.g. 2018):

7. *What is the main purpose for which you use your current monitor? (Select all that apply)
   - Work or productivity
   - Gaming
   - Entertainment (movies, TV shows, streaming)
   - Graphic design or video editing
   - General browsing and social media
   - Other (please specify):

8. If you selected "Other" in question 7, please provide more details:

9. *Please select the option that best describes the lighting in your viewing environment:
   - No additional light, display illumination only
   - Warm-led (yellowish tone)
   - Cool led (bright white tone)
   - Fluorescent (office lighting)
   - Sunlight
   - Mix of multiple light sources (please specify in the text box below)

10. If you selected "Mix of multiple light sources" in question 9, please provide more details:

11. *What is the highest level of formal education you have completed? If you are currently pursuing a qualification, please select your latest completed level:
    - GCE A levels or below, or equivalent
    - HNC, HND, NVQ at level 4+, Foundation Degree or equivalent
    - Bachelor's Degree or equivalent
    - Master's Degree or equivalent
    - Doctorate or equivalent

12. *How often do you access the Internet for any purpose (i.e., work/leisure, etc.)? This should include access from any device (desktop, laptop, tablet, or mobile) and any location (home, work, internet café, or anywhere).

13. *How frequently do you take photographs?
    - Multiple times a day
    - Daily
    - Several times a week
    - Once a week
    - Several times a month
    - Once a month
    - Rarely or never

14. *How often do you edit or retouch your own or others' images?
    - Never
    - Rarely
    - Occasionally
    - Frequently
    - Very frequently

15. *Which of the following subjects do you most often photograph? (Select all that apply)
    - Landscapes/nature
    - Animals
    - People
    - Food
    - Events (e.g., weddings, concerts, festivals)
    - Travel destinations
    - Still life (e.g., objects, flowers)
    - Other [please specify]:

16. If you answered "Other" in question 15, please provide more details:

17. *Was the 5-point scale (Bad, Poor, Average, Good, Excellent) adequate to describe the quality of the images you saw?
    - Yes
    - No

18. If you answered "No" in question 17, please provide your preferred changes to the scale (e.g., more/fewer points or different names):

19. *In your own words, how would you describe the difference in quality between an "excellent" and "poor" image?

20. Were there any unclear instructions before the experiment began?

21. Do you have any suggestions on how this experiment could be improved from your perspective?

22. Is there any additional feedback that you would like to provide regarding the experiment?
